abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome was unsatisfactory. Even
            though the physical objectives were somewhat met, the
            project failed to meet the agreed financial targets on
            break-even requirement, accounts receivable, and debt
            service coverage minima. Subsequently, at the time of
            retrofitting in mid-1997, several covenants were deleted
            from the Development Credit Agreement and the project
            development objectives as included in the Project Status
            Report were modified to reflect the project's revised
            goal of rehabilitating Aden's war-damaged power
            facilities. The sustainability of the physical investments
            financed under the project is assessed as likely since they
            form an integral part of the transmission and distribution
            system for the Aden Branch of the Public Electricity
            Corporation (PEC). However, PEC as an entity has yet to
            achieve financial viability. World Bank performance is
            adjudged satisfactory while Borrower performance is rated
            unsatisfactory. Key lessons concerned avoiding disagreements
            over contract awards by precisely drafting evaluation
            criteria in bidding documents; re-assessing the
            appropriateness of initial project objectives when major
            changes in the political, fiscal, and institutional
            environment are called for; avoiding procuring materials for
            works needed to fulfill project objectives and leaving it to
            the implementing agency after credit closure; supporting
            agreed loan covenants with appropriate action plans; and
            improving project implementation with close supervision.
